results.adx_keywords: Elections, House of Representatives;Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Redistricting and Reapportionment;Maloney, Sean Patrick;Lawler, Mike (1986- );Democratic Party;Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee;Republican Party;Hudson River Valley (NY);New York State
results.byline: By Jesse McKinley and Nicholas Fandos
results.title: Sean Patrick Maloney Concedes to Mike Lawler in Major Loss for Democrats
results.abstract: Mr. Maloney, who leads the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee, was seeking to represent a different district after New York’s messy redistricting process.

media.caption: Representative Sean Patrick Maloney, delivering a concession speech on Wednesday, led the Democratic Party’s campaign operation in the House.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections;Boebert, Lauren;House of Representatives;Republican Party;Colorado
results.title: The Republican provocateur Lauren Boebert is in an unexpectedly tight race in Colorado.
results.abstract: A freshman House member, Ms. Boebert, 35, was facing a stiff challenge from Adam Frisch, a Democrat.

media.caption: Representative Lauren Boebert of Colorado at the Conservative Political Action Conference in Dallas in August.
media.copyright: Emil Lippe for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Elections, Governors;Midterm Elections (2022);Abrams, Stacey Y;Kemp, Brian P;Republican Party;Democratic Party;Georgia
results.title: Gov. Brian Kemp Wins Re-election in Georgia, Topping Stacey Abrams
results.abstract: Ms. Abrams, a Democrat, bowed to Mr. Kemp, the Republican incumbent, in a rematch of their 2018 race. He had campaigned on his conservative policy wins.

results.title: Here are the uncalled races that could determine control of Congress.
results.abstract: Both chambers of Congress remained up for grabs, with crucial contests that could determine control yet to be called.

media.caption: An election worker processed ballots at the Maricopa County Election Center in Phoenix today. Arizona’s Senate race is one of the key contests around the country that have yet to be called.
media.copyright: Alisha Jucevic for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Social Media;Computers and the Internet;United States Politics and Government;Freedom of Speech and Expression;Musk, Elon;Twitter;Republican Party
results.byline: By Adam Satariano, Ryan Mac and Tiffany Hsu
results.title: Elon Musk Puts His Own Politics on Display on Election Day
results.abstract: The new owner of Twitter has urged his followers to vote Republican.

media.caption: Elon Musk, the new owner of Twitter, urged his 115 million followers on Twitter to vote Republican in Tuesday’s midterm elections.
media.copyright: ZZ/Wil R/Star Max, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Absentee Voting;Arizona;Georgia;Nevada;Wisconsin
results.title: When We’ll Know: The Remaining Key Factors in Georgia, Nevada, Arizona
results.abstract: Who will control the Senate and the House? Settle in for a long wait.

media.caption: As happened in the 2020 election, control of the Senate may come down to a Georgia runoff. Senator Raphael Warnock spoke to supporters in Atlanta after climbing into a narrow lead against Herschel Walker.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Elections;Midterm Elections (2022);Voting and Voters;Walker, Herschel;Warnock, Raphael G;Georgia
results.title: Once again control of the Senate may well be decided by a runoff election in Georgia.
results.abstract: Senator Raphael Warnock and his Republican challenger, Herschel Walker, are still neck and neck with less than half the vote. They will go to a runoff if neither gains 50 percent.

media.caption: Republican candidate Herschel Walker in Atlanta.
media.copyright: Audra Melton for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Endorsements;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Oz, Mehmet C;Walker, Herschel;Lake, Kari A;Vance, J D;DeSantis, Ron;Republican Party
results.byline: By Michael C. Bender and Maggie Haberman
results.title: Trump Hoped for a Celebration but Did Not Have Much to Cheer
results.abstract: The former president endorsed roughly 300 candidates in the midterm elections. With votes still being counted, those in competitive races appeared to have mixed results.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump speaking Tuesday at an election night party at his Mar-a-Lago resort in Palm Beach, Fla.
media.copyright: Josh Ritchie for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Elections, House of Representatives;Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Greene, Marjorie Taylor (1974- );Flowers, Marcus (1975- );Republican Party;Georgia
results.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Is Re-Elected and Poised for More Power in G.O.P.
results.abstract: The Georgia Republican’s racist and antisemitic conspiracy theories put her on the party’s fringes, but she is likely to play a more central role in the next Congress.

media.caption: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia, once seen as on the fringes of the Republican Party, won a second term in Congress, where she is poised to play a more central role.
media.copyright: Rebecca Noble for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Governors;Elections, Senate;Elections, House of Representatives;Trump, Donald J
results.title: While candidates made their final appeals, Trump tried to steal the spotlight.
results.abstract: President Biden and other major figures hit the campaign trail Monday, but former President Trump’s tease of a 2024 White House run also drew attention.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump in Dayton, Ohio, on Monday night.
media.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Hobbs, Kathleen M;Lake, Kari A;Trump, Donald J;Arizona
results.title: In Arizona’s race for governor, Hobbs defies expectations and takes a narrow lead.
results.abstract: The Democratic candidate’s mild manner has been a counterweight to her rival Kari Lake’s charismatic and antagonistic style.

media.caption: Katie Hobbs, Arizona’s secretary of state and the Democrats’ candidate for governor, in Mesa, Ariz., on Monday.
media.copyright: Caitlin O'Hara for The New York Times

results.abstract: Now you can compare yourself against Ashton Kutcher.

results.title: Trump Threatens to Reveal Unflattering Information About DeSantis if He Runs
results.abstract: “I know more about him than anybody other than perhaps his wife,” the former president reportedly said.

results.title: C.D.C. Links Deadly Listeria Outbreak to Deli Meats and Cheeses
results.abstract: Sixteen people in six states have been infected with the listeria strain, resulting in one death and 13 hospitalizations, the agency said.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: An electron microscope image of the Listeria monocytogenes bacterium, responsible for the food-borne illness listeriosis.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Governors;Politics and Government;Women and Girls;Governors (US);Records and Achievements;Content Type: Personal Profile;Hochul, Kathleen C;Democratic Party;New York State
results.title: After Historic Win, Hochul Confronts Challenges and Some Second-Guessing
results.abstract: Gov. Kathy Hochul managed to repel late momentum by her Republican opponent, Lee Zeldin. Now she must govern over a fractured New York electorate.

results.adx_keywords: Labor and Jobs;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Computers and the Internet;Social Media;Metaverse (Internet);Virtual Reality (Computers);Zuckerberg, Mark E;Meta Platforms Inc;Facebook Inc;Instagram Inc;WhatsApp Inc
results.byline: By Sheera Frenkel, Adam Satariano and Ryan Mac
results.title: Meta Lays Off More Than 11,000 Employees
results.abstract: The parent of Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp reduced its work force by 13 percent and extended a hiring freeze through the first quarter of next year.

media.caption: Mark Zuckerberg, Meta’s chief executive, met with executives on Tuesday about the layoffs.
media.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Generation Z;United States Politics and Government;Elections, House of Representatives;Frost, Maxwell Alejandro;Florida
results.title: 25-Year-Old Florida Democrat Secures Generation Z’s First House Seat
results.abstract: Maxwell Alejandro Frost focused on issues important to many young voters: gun violence, climate change, abortion rights and Medicare for all.

media.caption: Maxwell Alejandro Frost, a progressive Democrat, focused on issues of concern to younger voters. “I come from a generation that has gone through more mass-shooting drills than fire drills,” he said.

results.title: Moore, a Democrat, Will Become Maryland’s First Black Governor
results.abstract: Wes Moore, the celebrity author and former nonprofit executive, defeated a far-right Republican backed by former President Donald J. Trump.

media.caption: Wes Moore, right, with his family during an election-night gathering after he was declared the winner of the Maryland gubernatorial race.

results.title: The Republican Wave That Wasn’t
results.abstract: Making sense of the unexpected midterm results.

results.byline: By Tracey Tully and Lauren Hard
results.title: Republican Tom Kean Jr. Defeats Rep. Tom Malinowski, a Democrat, in New Jersey
results.abstract: The race, a rematch from 2020, had been considered the state’s most competitive congressional contest.

media.caption: Tom Kean Jr. had strong backing from the national Republican Party.
media.copyright: Andrew Seng for The New York Times
